content.en: Secure OFDM Systems: Researchers have been investigating ways to enhance the security of optical OFDM systems. They have explored the use of algorithms such as chaos scrambling, permutation, controlled Logistic map, and multi-dimensional chaos to improve physical layer security and protect against chosen-plaintext attacks. These algorithms provide secure transmission, improve performance, reduce PAPR, and enhance security in OFDM-PONs. Additionally, encryption schemes that combine cellular automata, DNA encoding, and probabilistic shaping have been proposed to further enhance security in CO-OFDM systems.
content.da: Sikre OFDM-systemer: Forskere har undersøgt måder at forbedre sikkerheden i optiske OFDM-systemer. De har udforsket brugen af algoritmer som kaos-scrambling, permutation, kontrolleret logistisk kort og multi-dimensionelt kaos for at forbedre sikkerheden på det fysiske lag og beskytte mod kendt-plaintext angreb. Disse algoritmer muliggør sikker transmission, forbedrer ydeevnen, reducerer PAPR og øger sikkerheden i OFDM-PONs. Derudover er krypteringsordninger, der kombinerer cellulære automater, DNA-kodning og probabilistisk formning, blevet foreslået for yderligere at forbedre sikkerheden i CO-OFDM systemer.
